title: Malcolm Turnbull’s Official Prime Ministerial Portrait Revealed | 10 News+
description: Malcolm Turnbull's Prime Ministerial portrait has been unveiled in parliament. title: Websites Used To Make AI-Generated Child Abuse Images Blocked In Australia | 10 News+
description: The E-Safety Commissioner announced today that Aussies will be blocked from three services that have been used to 'nudify' unsuspecting victims. The websites work by using artificial intelligence to edit images of real people, and children, to appear naked. title: Hoodoo Gurus Superfan’s Wish Comes True After 40 Years | 10 News+
description: Few people would hold out hope of receiving of a reply to a handwritten letter from a famous rockstar 40 years after posting it. But patience has paid off for a Melbourne megafan of Aussie rock gods, The Hoodoo Gurus. Back in 1985 the band had just released a second hit album and superfan Elisse Baitz, who was just 13 years old at the time, decided to send her idols a letter. That letter has just been answered by none other than band's frontman, Dave Faulkner. title: New Study Finds Famous Singers Die Earlier Than Normal People | 10 News
description: Being rich and famous might seem like a surefire way to live your best – and longest – life.  But it turns out that fame can be a killer, with star singers dying before their lesser known counterparts. title: Hong Kong Death Toll Rises To 55 As Firefighters Continue To Battle Apartment Blaze | 10 News
description: The death toll from the Hong Kong fire disaster has risen to at least 55 but hundreds of others are still unaccounted for.  Firefighters have been spending the day putting out spot fires that have flared up as the city comes to grips with one of its deadliest infernos in decades. title: Three Construction Bosses Arrested As Hong Kong Fire Death Toll Rises To 83 | 10 News
description: The death toll from the Hong Kong fire disaster has risen to at least 83, with almost 300 people still missing.  Hong Kong's Chief Executive John Lee said police have arrested three men who are the company executives working for the building maintenance company responsible for the housing estate, as an inspection into renovations using bamboo scaffolding are underway.  Firefighters say they have largely contained the blaze, which has been raging for more than 24 hours and ripped through the Wang Fuk Court housing complex in the northern district of Tai Po. title: Details Revealed About D.C. National Guard Shooting Suspect | 10 News
description: Authorities have revealed the man identified as the suspect in the shooting of two National Guard soldiers near the White House in Washington, D.C. as Afghan national Rahmanullah Lakanwal, who worked with "partner forces" during the United States' war in Afghanistan.  The two National Guard soliders shot in the attack, 20-year-old Sarah Beckstrom and 24-year-old Andrew Wolfe, are fighting for life in hospital and remain in a critical condition.  The 29-year-old Lakanwal entered the United States in 2021 through then-President Joe Biden's Operation Allies Welcome, following the US withdrawal from Afghanistan.

title: Two Palestinians Shot After Apparent Surrender In West Bank | 10 News
description: Two Palestinian men who appeared to be surrendering were shot dead during an Israeli raid in Jenin, with footage showing them lifting their shirts, lying on the ground and then being ordered back inside a building before shots were fired.   A Reuters journalist at the scene saw the men emerge with their hands raised and later witnessed Israeli forces standing beside what appeared to be a lifeless body.   The Palestinian Health Ministry identified them as 26-year-old Montasir Abdullah and 37-year-old Yusuf Asasa, condemning the deaths as an execution.   The Palestinian Authority's ambassador to the United Kingdom, Husam Zomlot, labelled the incident “summary executions” and a “war crime” that fits a wider pattern across the occupied territory.   Israeli authorities said the men were wanted for terror activity and have opened an investigation, but offered no explanation for why they were shot after appearing to surrender. title: One National Guard Soldier Dead As New Details Emerge On Washington, D.C. Shooter | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has revealed that one of the two National Guard members who were shot in Washington DC yesterday has died.   It comes as new details about the suspected shooter are revealed, including his previous work with the CIA in Afghanistan.   CBS correspondent Natalie Brand has the details.
